Returns: This ParallaxEffect object, allowing calls to methods in this class to be chained.
Parameters: Property: The target property that will receive values.
target(T, android.util.Property<T, V>).Description: Creates a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ParallaxTarget_E@ using direct mapping from source property into target property, the new @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ParallaxTarget_E@ will be added to its list of targets.
target(T, android.util.Property<T, V>).FullName: ParallaxEffect target (T targetObject, Property<T, V> targetProperty)

getPropertyRanges().Description: Returns the list of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Parallax#PropertyMarkerValue_E@s, which represents the range of values that source variables can take.

ClassDesc: ParallaxEffect class drives changes in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ParallaxTarget_E@ in response to changes in variables defined in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Parallax_E@. ParallaxEffect has a list of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Parallax#PropertyMarkerValue_E@s which represents the range of values that source variables can take. The main function is @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ParallaxEffect#performMapping_E@ which computes a fraction between 0 and 1 based on the current values of variables in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Parallax_E@. As the parallax effect goes on, the fraction increases from 0 at beginning to 1 at the end. Then the fraction is passed on to @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ParallaxTarget#update_E@. App use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Parallax#addEffect_E@ to create a ParallaxEffect.
